casebody.data:
Lucy F. WILKERSON, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Elliot L. RICHARDSON, Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, Defendant-Appellee. No. 72-2412

Summary Calendar.*

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. Nov. 6, 1972. Maxine T. McConnell, Walter W. Steele, Jr., Dallas, Tex., for plaintiff-appellant. Eldon B. Mahon, U. S. Atty., Dallas, Tex., Morton Hollander, Thomas J. Press, Attys., Dept, of Justice, Washington, D. C., for defendant-appellee.

Before BELL, DYER and CLARK, Circuit Judges.

Rule 18, 5 Cir.; see Isbell Enterprises, Inc. v. Citizens Casualty Company of New York et al., 5 Cir. 1970, 431 F.2d 409, Part I.

 PER CURIAM:

The district court found that the decision of the Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare denying appellant disability benefits was supported by substantial evidence. We agree. The judgment is

Affirmed.
